name: The Good Place
the-point: If you could live in a perfect utopia where every wish is granted, would you eventually get bored and want to leave?
context: Explores the necessity of struggle for human happiness.

name: Ship of Theseus
the-point: If you replace every plank of a wooden ship one by one, is it still the same ship once every part is new?
context: A classic debate on identity and the self.

name: Free Will
the-point: Do we actually have free will, or is every choice just a result of biology and past experiences?

name: Experience Machine
the-point: If you could plug into a machine that gave you a perfectly happy life but it wasn't 'real', would you do it?

name: Objective Morality
the-point: Is anything truly 'evil', or is morality just a social contract we made to survive?

name: Legacy
the-point: Does it matter if people remember you after you die if you aren't around to see it?
context: The value of legacy and fame.

name: Nature vs Nurture
the-point: Are people born 'bad', or does the world make them that way?

name: Meaning of Life
the-point: Is the meaning of life something you find, or something you have to create?

name: Animal Rights
the-point: If an alien race more intelligent than humans arrived, would they be justified in treating us like we treat livestock?

name: Eternal Life
the-point: If you were offered immortality but you could never die—even after the universe ends—would you take it?

name: Art Interpretation
the-point: Does the artist's intention matter, or is the meaning of art entirely up to the viewer?

name: The Greater Good
the-point: Is it okay to do something 'bad' if it results in a massive 'good' for everyone else?

name: Consciousness
the-point: If we perfectly simulated a human brain in a computer, would that computer be 'alive' and have feelings?

name: Time Linearity
the-point: If time is a circle and everything repeats, does your life have more or less value?

name: Knowledge Value
the-point: Is it better to be a 'sad wise man' or a 'happy fool'?

name: Justice vs Mercy
the-point: In a perfect legal system, should the goal be to punish the criminal or to rehabilitate them?

name: Privacy of Thought
the-point: If technology allowed people to read your thoughts, would society become more honest or completely collapse?

name: Universal Beauty
the-point: Is beauty truly in the eye of the beholder, or are some things mathematically more beautiful than others?

name: Personal Sacrifice
the-point: Would you sacrifice your own life to save 100 strangers you’ve never met?

name: Reality Perception
the-point: How do you know that everyone else sees the color 'blue' the same way you do?

name: Work and Worth
the-point: If humans didn't have to work to survive, would we still have a reason to get out of bed?

name: Laws and Ethics
the-point: If a law is unjust, do you have a moral obligation to break it?

name: Simulated Pain
the-point: Is it wrong to 'hurt' a video game character if the AI is advanced enough to mimic pain perfectly?

name: Power Influence
the-point: Does power corrupt people, or does it just reveal who they actually were all along?

name: The End
the-point: If you knew the exact date of your death, would you live more fully or spend the whole time in fear?
